snippet: At last, a federal judge reviews and rules against the National Security Agency’s phone-data collection program.
abstract: Editorial heralds decision by Federal Judge Richard Leon finding that the National Security Agency's vast dragnet of American phone records is 'significantly likely' to be unconstitutional; welcomes fact that cloak of secrecy has been lifted so that program can be evaluated in a true court of law.
lead_paragraph: At last, a federal judge reviews and rules against the National Security Agency’s phone-data collection program.

headline.main: A Powerful Rebuke of Mass Surveillance
headline.print_headline: A Powerful Rebuke of Mass Surveillance

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
